text:
Hamilton Avenue, at Smith Street (right), looking north toward Bush Street--where buildings are being torn down--and showing the area which is being converted into the northern sector of the Belt Parkway. The white building is the Devoe and Raynolds Paint Company warehouse.

October 17, 1940

P. L. Sperr

Hamilton Avenue, east side, at Smith Street, showing plant No. 1 of the Devoe and Raynolds Company, paint manufacturers. The building was demolished later in the year to facilitate the widening of the avenue as part of the Belt Parkway.
ViCV1NReg.NIe A-1o26  September 7, 1940
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The Gowanus Canal side of the factory, seen from the south end
of the bridge.
October 23, 1940
P. L. Sperr

Smith Street towards Hamilton Avenue, fr. Centre Street, Brooklyn.

P. L. Sperr, photographer
July 26, 1940

Gowanus Canal Bridge: West 9th Street

Smith Street, north from Hamilton Avenue to Centre Street, showing the cleared area on the west side of the street (left), which will become part of the Belt Parkway system. The buildings on the right belong to the Independent Salt Company division of the International Salt Company. In the background is the West 9th Street bridge over the Gowanus Canal.

View 1: October 17, 1940
Views 2, 3: July 24, 1940

View 2 is east on Mill Street; view 3, east on Garnet Street.

P. L. Sperr
